1.text: Then, when the Lord learned that the Pharisees had heard, “Jesus is making and baptizing more disciples than John”

2.text: (although Jesus himself did not baptize, but his disciples),

3.text: he left Judea and departed into Galilee.

4.text: Now he needed to pass through Samaria.

5.text: And so, he arrived at a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob had given to his son Joseph;

6.text: and Jacob’s well was there. Jesus, tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.

7.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me [something] to drink.”

8.text: (For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food).

9.text: The Samaritan woman then said to him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

10.text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water!”

11.text: The woman replied, “Sir, you have nothing to draw [water] with, and the well is deep! Where then do you get that living water?

12.text: Are you greater than our father Jacob who gave us the well and drank of it himself, as did his children and his livestock?”

13.text: Jesus replied, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again!

14.text: But whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again. Not only this, the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”

15.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I may never be thirsty or come here to draw [water]!”

16.text: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”

17.text: The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus replied, “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’

18.text: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truthfully.”

19.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet!

20.text: Our ancestors expressed adoration in this mountain, and you [Jews] say that Jerusalem is the place where people should express adoration.”

21.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, a time is coming when neither in this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you express adoration to the Father.

22.text: You express adoration to what you do not know. We express adoration to what we know, for salvation is from the Jews.

23.text: But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will express adoration to the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father is seeking such [people] to express adoration to him.

24.text: God is a spirit, and those who express adoration to him must express adoration in spirit and truth.”

25.text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming, (he who is called Christ). When he comes, he will proclaim all things to us.”

26.text: Jesus replied, “I am he, the one who is speaking to you.”

27.text: Just then, his disciples arrived. They were astonished that he was speaking with a woman, yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?”

28.text: Then the woman left her water jar, went away into the city, and said to the people,

29.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything I have ever done! Could this be the Christ?”

30.text: The people [then] went out of the city, and were coming to him.

31.text: Meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying, “Rabbi, eat!”

32.text: But he told them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”

33.text: The disciples then said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

34.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of the one who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

35.text: Do you not say, ‘There are still four months until the harvest comes?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields! They are already white for the harvest!

36.text: And the one who reaps is receiving his wages and gathering fruit to eternal life; so that both the one who sows and the one who reaps may rejoice together!

37.text: For in this, the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’

38.text: I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into [the rewards of] their labor.”

39.text: Many of the Samaritans from that city believed in him because of the word of the woman who had testified, “He told me everything that I did!”

40.text: For this reason, when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. So, he stayed there two days,

41.text: and many more believed because of his word.

42.text: Then they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, but because we have heard for ourselves and [we] know that this is indeed the Savior of the world, the Christ.”

43.text: After the two days, Jesus departed from there and went into Galilee.

44.text: (For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country).

45.text: When he came into Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, having seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast.

46.text: Therefore, Jesus returned to Cana of Galilee where he had turned the water into wine. Now there was a certain royal official whose son was sick at Capernaum.

47.text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.

48.text: Jesus then said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will never believe!”

49.text: The nobleman replied, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

50.text: Jesus told him, “Go on your way. Your son lives.” So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and he went on his way.

51.text: Even as he was on the way, his slaves met him and told him the news: “Your child lives!”

52.text: He asked them the hour when the boy had begun to get better. Then they told him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him!”

53.text: And so, the father learned that it was at that [very] hour in which Jesus had said to him, “Your son lives.” And he believed, along with his whole household.

54.text: This was the second sign that Jesus performed on his return from Judea into Galilee.
